chase.description: compare generated code to your model, changing both until you've replicated the model with your template

check.description: checks that the code has been entered safely, meaning that regeneration won't lose any changes

args.name: code
args.description: path to the code base to check

generate.description: generates code based on a template and a settings file. To set the template, you need the template flag.
examples:
$ geenee generate sampleCode -t sampleTemplate -n
You have executed the generate command...

template.name: template
template.description: Template directory. Will generate from the template, and will override any prior template or template version used.

noSetup.name: noSetup
noSetup.description: Do not update the startup routine (this is only relevant when the template flag is also used). Saves a lot of time for a template developer.

args.name: code
args.description: path to the code base to generate

pounce.description: specify a model code base and generate a template to build it

templateDir.name: templateDir
templateDir.description: path to the generator that you will build

args.name: model
args.description: path to a model code base from which you will generate your template

settings.description: change your settings for the next generation
examples:
$ geenee settings sampleCode
You have executed the settings command...
